info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 2:36AM CST until February 22 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Periodic freezing rain or freezing drizzle expected. Total ice accumulations of a glaze up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Primarily the northern portions of Winnebago, Boone and McHenry Counties, including Rockton, Capron, and Harvard. * WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 4 PM CST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy roads, including I-39 and I-90 north of Rockford. Bridges and overpasses as well as untreated roads and sidewalks are most vulnerable.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
